newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Cricket - Bichel's 10 wickets set up Queensland win.
newsitem.headline: Cricket - Bichel's 10 wickets set up Queensland win.

text.p: Pace bowler Andrew Bichel set up a decisive Sheffield Shield win for Queensland over Victoria on Monday by taking 10 wickets in the match in a career-best performance.
Bichel took 5-69 in Victoria's second innings to add to his first innings haul of 5-46 as Queensland beat Victoria by eight wickets to maintain their lead in the Shield standings.
Queensland have 18 points from three wins this season and are 10 clear of New South Wales in second place.
Victoria were dismissed in their second innings for 277 after adding only nine runs to their overnight total for a paltry lead of 134.
Opening batsman Matthew Hayden hit 73 as Queensland reached 137 for two with over a session of play remaining.
In Adelaide, Western Australia captain Tom Moody hit 89 not out to help his side to victory by five wickets over South Australia.
Set a target of 285 to win, Western Australia reached 288 for five in the final session of play. Damien Martyn added 37 to his first innings of 96.
The win was Western Australia's first of the season from two matches while South Australia remain at the bottom of the Shield table with no points.
In Hobart, Tasmania came within one wicket of outright defeat by New South Wales before salvaging a draw.
New South Wales declared their second innings closed on 225 for three 30 minutes before lunch after a whirlwind 101 not out by all-rounder Shane Lee.
Tasmania, needing 302 for an unlikely win, reached 268 for nine in reply, tail-enders Mark Ridgeway and Mark Atkinson successfully fending away the final 14 deliveries before stumps were drawn.
New South Wales earned two points for their superior first innings total of 403 for nine declared.
